tezcatlipoca-steps.text: Yellow and black stripes are used for the face.
The spear is used to judge humans.
The obsidian mirror is used for divination.
The elaborate headdress represents swirling smoke that emanates from his mirror.
Tezcatlipoca’s foot was bitten off by Tlaltecuhtli or Cipactli in a battle. It is sometimes replaced by smoke, a scroll or a snake.
Circular pectoral (“anáhuatl”) over the chest, made up of a white shell ring tied on by a red leather strap.
Nose plug made from jade as a religious and/or social ranking ornament.
Missing symbol in this illustration: the ezpitzal (gust of blood) symbolizing anger, rage or madness.
